text: An alternatively spliced isoform of the <extra_id_0> Spi-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription factor .

<extra_id_0> Spi-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an Ets transcription factor related to the oncoprotein <extra_id_0> Spi-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and highly expressed in B lymphoid cells .
The Ets proteins share a conserved Ets domain that mediates specific DNA binding .
<extra_id_0> Spi-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds DNA sequences containing a core 5'-GGAA-3 ' and activates transcription through this motif .
Up to date , the biological function of <extra_id_0> Spi-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> remains unknown .

Here , we describe the characterization of an alternatively spliced variant of <extra_id_0> Spi-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , named <extra_id_0> deltaSpi-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which has lost the Ets domain .
In B lymphoid cells , <extra_id_0> deltaspi-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> spi-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNAs were present simultaneously in a ratio of around 10 % .
